etymology.description: 糸(糸) (mì, "rope") + 罔(罔) (wǎng, "net") = rope and phonetic value -> net
etymology.interpretation: The character 網(wǎng) combines 糸(糸) (mì, "rope"), indicating its use in weaving or creating nets, with 罔(罔) (wǎng, "net"), which provides the sound. This combination effectively conveys the idea of a network or a mesh made from woven ropes.
etymology.simplification: The character was simplified to 网 by using its ancient form, which uses fewer strokes.

examples.chinese: 我用网捕捉鲤鱼(我用網捕捉鯉魚)。
examples.english: I use a net to catch carp.

examples.chinese: 他在海边撒下了网(他在海邊撒下了網)，希望能捕到大鱼(希望能捕到大魚)。
examples.pinyin: Tā zài hǎibiān sā xià le wǎng, xīwàng néng bǔ dào dàyú.
examples.english: He cast a net by the seaside, hoping to catch a big fish.
